thread.title: Game of the Week: Pivotal game for James Monroe and Westside
thread.title_full: Game of the Week: Pivotal game for James Monroe and Westside

author: A.J. Good
title: Game of the Week: Pivotal game for James Monroe and Westside
text:
Game of the Week: Pivotal game for James Monroe and Westside - WVVA TV Bluefield Beckley WV News, Weather and Sports Member Center: Game of the Week: Pivotal game for James Monroe and Westside Posted: 
Oceana, WV 
WVVA-TV 
James Monroe has been the welcome surprise so far of the 2015 season. the mavericks are 5-0 coming into Friday's game, starting a tough stretch to end the season. "We are excited. We are excited to play some good teams coming up and we are ready for the challenge" said sophomore RB Grant Mohler. 
The Mavericks have had quite the history with the Renegades in their short history, and they know this weekend will be another hard fought battle. "They have so much power. They are good up front and a good power game and a passing game. They got a couple good linebackers and its going to be a tough one" said James Monroe head coach John Mustain. 
After a rough start, Westside has now pushed its way back into the top 16 with wins over Independence and Scott, and it took some balance on offense to get this team rolling. "We have been running the ball better on offense and we've been holding back the passing game waiting on this week. We are going to have to run the ball and throw it, and be a 50/50 team this week" said Westside head coach Larry Cook. 
The Renegades defense will now have to step up big on friday night, and try to control the Mavericks two headed attack. "Can't cheat this game. Can't shut down their three or four favorite plays and you have to play them up and play them honest. That's the sign of a good team and a good offense when you have to play them straight up honest" said Cook. 
The name of the game will be who is the most physical, and who can do the little things right. "Cut out mistakes things like that. Hopefully makes some plays on special teams. Hopefully this defense will continue to play the way its been playing" said Mustain."We got to weather the storm and stay in the game. Stay in the trenches and fight, scratch, and claw and play with that pride that we've tried to build in here the last two years and hopefully my guys are up to the task" said Cook. More >> Bland Co and Giles remain undefeated with Monday night wins Bluefield, WVWVVA-TVBoth Bland Co and Giles Co improved to 5-0 with wins on Monday night. Bland Co defeated Montcalm 42-12, and Giles knocked off Galax 35-24. The Bears are off to the best start in school history. Giles has gone to 5-0 for the 4th year in a row. Up next, Bland will play at Narrows on Saturday. Giles will travel to Glenvar on Saturday. More >> Bluefield, WVWVVA-TVBoth Bland Co and Giles Co improved to 5-0 with wins on Monday night.
